Detailed Description

Estimate the degree of spatial displacement between two similar grids.

Author:
v.lakshmanan

edu.ou.asgbook.transforms.AlignmentEstimator.AlignmentEstimator ( int  maxu,
int  maxv,
LatLonGrid  a,
LatLonGrid  b 
)

convolve a with b and find where the maximum correlation lies 

00025                                                                              {
00026         this.MAXU = maxu;
00027         this.MAXV = maxv;
00028         
00029         // a
00030         Complex[][] in1 = FFT2D.fft(FFT2D.zeropad(a));
00031         
00032         // zero-out an area of thickness MAXU/MAXV around the boundary to avoid boundary issues
00033         LatLonGrid centerb = LatLonGrid.copyOf(b);
00034         int minx = MAXU;
00035         int miny = MAXV;
00036         int maxx = centerb.getNumLat() - minx;
00037         int maxy = centerb.getNumLon() - miny;
00038         for (int i=0; i < b.getNumLat(); ++i){
00039             for (int j=0; j < b.getNumLon(); ++j){
00040                 if (i < minx || j < miny || i > maxx || j > maxy){
00041                     centerb.setValue(i, j, 0);
00042                 }
00043             }
00044         }
00045         Complex[][] in2 = FFT2D.fft(FFT2D.zeropad(centerb));
00046         
00047         // find phase shift at this point
00048         for (int i=0; i < in1.length; ++i) for (int j=0; j < in1[0].length; ++j){
00049             in1[i][j] = in1[i][j].multiply(in2[i][j].conjugate());
00050             in1[i][j] = in1[i][j].multiply( 1.0 / in1[i][j].norm() );
00051         }
00052         // take ifft
00053         Complex[][] result = FFT2D.ifft(in1);
00054         
00055         // find location at which the convolved result is maximum
00056         double bestValue = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
00057         int startx = 0; // result.length/2 - MAXU;
00058         int starty = 0; // result[0].length/2 - MAXV;
00059         int endx = result.length; // /2 + MAXU;
00060         int endy = result[0].length; // /2 + MAXV;
00061         for (int i=startx; i < endx; ++i) for (int j=starty; j < endy; ++j){
00062             if ( result[i][j].normsq() > bestValue ){
00063                 bestValue = result[i][j].real;
00064                 motNS = -i;
00065                 motEW = -j;
00066             }
00067         }
00068         
00069         // we don't want a 345-degree phase shift; we want it to be 15-degrees
00070         if ( Math.abs(motNS) > result.length/2 ){
00071             if (motNS < 0) motNS += result.length;
00072             else motNS -= result.length;
00073         }
00074         if ( Math.abs(motEW) > result[0].length/2 ){
00075             if (motEW < 0) motEW += result[0].length;
00076             else motEW -= result[0].length;
00077         }
00078     }

Member Function Documentation

static Pixel edu.ou.asgbook.transforms.AlignmentEstimator.computeCentroid ( LatLonGrid  a  )  [static] 

00080                                                      {
00081         double sumx = 0;
00082         double sumy = 0;
00083         double sumwt = 0;
00084         int N = 0;
00085         for (int i=0; i < a.getNumLat(); ++i) for (int j=0; j < a.getNumLon(); ++j){
00086             double wt = a.getValue(i,j);
00087             sumx += i * wt;
00088             sumy += j * wt;
00089             sumwt += wt;
00090             ++N;
00091         }
00092         return new Pixel((int)Math.round(sumx/sumwt), (int)Math.round(sumy/sumwt), (int)Math.round(sumwt/N));
00093     }

static void edu.ou.asgbook.transforms.AlignmentEstimator.main ( String[]  args  )  throws Exception [static] 

00095                                                             {
00096         // because the alignment doesn't really check lat-lon extents,
00097         // cropping from offset corners will look like translation ...
00098         LatLonGrid conus = GlobalPopulation.read(GlobalPopulation.NORTHAMERICA);
00099         LatLonGrid[] grids = new LatLonGrid[2];
00100         grids[0] = conus.crop(900, 2500, 256, 256);
00101         int motx = 5; int moty = 9;
00102         grids[1] = conus.crop(900-motx, 2500-moty, 256, 256);
00103         
00104         // do alg
00105         AlignmentEstimator alg = new AlignmentEstimator(30,30,grids[0], grids[1]);
00106         System.out.println("Motion N/S ="  + alg.motNS + " true N/S=" + motx);
00107         System.out.println("Motion E/W ="  + alg.motEW + " true E/W=" + moty);
00108         
00109         System.out.println("Centroid of first = " + computeCentroid(grids[0]));
00110         System.out.println("Centroid of second = " + computeCentroid(grids[1]));
00111         
00112         // based on edges alone
00113         SobelEdgeFilter edgeFilter = new SobelEdgeFilter();
00114         LatLonGrid edge1 = edgeFilter.edgeFilter(grids[0]);
00115         LatLonGrid edge2 = edgeFilter.edgeFilter(grids[1]);
00116         AlignmentEstimator alg2 = new AlignmentEstimator(30,30,edge1, edge2);
00117         System.out.println("Edge Motion N/S ="  + alg2.motNS );
00118         System.out.println("Edge Motion E/W ="  + alg2.motEW );
00119     }
